column1: CHICAGO --   Carlos Rodon kept putting runners on base -- and the defense kept wiping them out . 	 The Chicago White Sox did not put many runners on . But they finally managed to score while the Cubs never did . 	 Pinch - hitter J.B. Shuck drove in Emilio Bonifacio with a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning
column2: and the White Sox beat the Cubs 1 - 0 on Friday
column3: their eighth win in 10 games . 	 Neither starter allowed a run
column4: with the Cubs ' Kyle Hendricks going seven innings in his third straight scoreless start . 	 Rodon lasted six innings for the White Sox despite some control issues . As manager Robin Ventura put it
column5: he performed " kind of a Houdini act out there . " 	 The South Siders then opened the crosstown series on a winning note thanks to that run in the eighth and a season - high five double plays by the Cubs . 	 The rally started when Bonifacio
column7: got hit by Hector Rondon ( 3 - 2 ) leading off the eighth . He stole second and advanced to third on a sacrifice bunt by Adam Eaton before Shuck drove him in with a sacrifice fly to left . 	 That made a winner of Jake Petricka ( 3 - 2 )
column8: who worked the seventh . Zach Duke struck out three and walked one in the eighth . David Robertson picked up his 19th save in 23 chances
column9: striking out Kris Bryant and Jorge Soler in the ninth before second baseman Carlos Sanchez dived to his right to snag Chris Coglan 's liner
column10: ending the game . 	 All that happened after Hendricks dominated yet again and Rodon got by despite the control issues . 	 Hendricks ran his scoreless innings streak to 22 1 - 3 . The right - hander gave up five hits and struck out four without a walk
column11: although he did hit Jose Abreu . 	 In his last three starts
column12: he has lowered his ERA from 4.46 to 3.55 . 	 " I 've felt sharper
column15: " Hendricks said . " I still do n't feel 100 percent sharp . But as far as my mentality right now
column16: I think it 's as good as it 's maybe ever been . " 	 Rodon gave up two hits and struck out six for the White Sox . He walked six but was helped by four double plays . 	 " They kept me in the game
column17: " Rodon said . " Those quick double plays kept my pitch count down . Without that I would have probably been gone by the fourth . But defensively we played great and that 's what kept us in the game . " 	 None of the double plays were bigger or wilder than the one that ended the third . It happened after Hendricks singled with one out and Addison Russell walked . 	 Right fielder Avisail Garcia raced in for a sliding catch on Dexter Fowler 's sinking liner
column18: barely snagging the ball before it hit the ground . He rolled over and dropped the ball as he transferred it out of his glove . 	 He then threw wide to first attempting to double off Russell
column19: and the ball hit the dugout railing . Catcher Tyler Flowers recovered it and threw to second to double off Hendricks
column20: who was standing on third . 	 The Cubs challenged the play . But it was upheld after a review . 	 " I really thought the ball did hit the ground
column21: " Cubs manager Joe Maddon said . " I do n't even know
column23: if it was shown it did not . But beyond all that
column24: just to have total control of the baseball . " 	 HONORING BANKS
column25: MINOSO 	 There was a video tribute and moment of silence before the game for Cubs Hall of Famer Ernie Banks and White Sox great Minnie Minoso
column26: who both died in the offseason . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 White Sox : SS Alexei Ramirez was back in the lineup after fouling a ball off his left foot Wednesday against Toronto . He did not play Thursday . 	 Cubs : The Cubs do not expect RHP Jason Hammel to miss a turn in the rotation after he left Wednesday 's start against St. Louis because of tightness in his left hamstring . ... INF Mike Olt ( hairline fracture in his right wrist ) was reinstated from the 60 - day DL and optioned to Triple - A Iowa . ... GM Jed Hoyer says INF Tommy La Stella ( rib cage inflammation ) and 2B prospect Javier Baez
column27: who broke his left ring finger playing for Triple - A Iowa last month
column28: are starting to resume baseball activities . 	 UP NEXT 	 It 's ace against ace
column29: with LHP Chris Sale ( 7 - 4
column30: 2.80 ERA ) starting for the White Sox and LHP Jon Lester ( 4 - 7
column31: 3.48 ) for the Cubs . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: CLEVELAND --   Danny Salazar was within one out of his second career complete game . Instead he had to settle for another dominant performance by a Cleveland starting pitcher . 	 Salazar scattered five hits while allowing an unearned run in 8 2/3 innings and the Indians used a four - run sixth to beat the Oakland Athletics 5 - 1 on Friday night . 	 Salazar ( 8 - 4 )
column3: retired the first two hitters in the ninth before Ben Zobrist doubled . With the crowd of 28
column5: Salazar hit Billy Butler with an 0 - 2 pitch . 	 " I was a little tired and I tried to throw a little bit harder
column7: who pitched a complete game against Detroit on Sept. 3
column8: 2014 .. " I tried to slow myself down . I was one out away
column9: but it was a good game . " 	 Cody Allen then got Ike Davis to foul out for his 19th save and third in three nights . 	 " You 'd love to see Danny finish
column10: but in that situation you want to give Cody a little wiggle room
column11: " manager Terry Francona said . " Danny did a really good job
column12: but it was time to get him out . " 	 Cleveland 's four - game winning streak has been sparked by strong starting pitching
column13: which has compiled a 0.90 ERA ( three earned runs in 30 innings ) and has limited opponents to a .181 average . 	 " It 's exciting to see
column14: " Salazar said . " You see one guy do it and you want to do the same thing . " 	 Oakland catcher Josh Phegley had one of the five hits off Salazar
column15: a single in the fifth inning
column16: but struck out in the eighth . 	 " My last at - bat I think he threw me five different pitches for strikes
column17: " Phegley said . " Seemed like he had everything going . " 	 The Athletics ' only run came in the first after an error by second baseman Jason Kipnis . After Billy Burns led off with a single
column18: Mark Canha reached on Kipnis ' error on a fielder 's choice . Canha was forced at second on Josh Reddick 's grounder and Zobrist walked to load the bases . Butler then had a sacrifice fly . 	 Kendall Graveman ( 6 - 5 ) allowed four runs in 6 2/3 innings for his first loss since June 13 . Graveman 's 19 - inning scoreless streak ended on Yan Gomes ' RBI double in the fourth that tied the score . 	 Kipnis drew a bases - loaded walk in the sixth off reliever Drew Pomeranz to put Cleveland ahead 2 - 1 . Francisco Lindor walked to force in another run and Michael Brantley had a two - run single . 	 The Athletics have dropped nine of 14 . 	 Carlos Santana singled off Graveman to start the sixth and took third on Giovanny Urshela 's two - out single . Michael Bourn walked to load the bases . Pomeranz replaced Graveman but issued a five - pitch walk to Kipnis . 	 Lindor walked on a full - count pitch
column19: prompting a visit from pitching coach Curt Young . Brantley lined the next pitch into center field for a 5 - 1 lead . 	 " We showed some patience and Brantley came through with the big hit
column20: " Francona said . 	 FINALLY 	 Friday 's win was only the second series - opening victory at home for the Indians this season . Cleveland is 2 - 13 in series openers at Progressive Field . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Athletics : LHP Sean Doolittle ( strained shoulder ) played catch at 75 feet Thursday and had no issues . He 's on the 15 - day disabled list for the second time this season . 	 Indians : RHP Josh Tomlin
column21: who had shoulder surgery in March
column22: pitched 2 2/3 scoreless innings on a rehab assignment at Double - A Akron on Friday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Athletics : RHP Chris Bassitt will be called up from Triple - A Nashville to start Saturday . He 'll take the spot of RHP Jesse Hahn
column23: who has a strained forearm . 	 Indians : RHP Carlos Carrasco
column24: who came within one out of a no - hitter in Tampa Bay on July 1
column25: allowed four runs in the first inning and got the loss in his last start against Houston on Monday . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column28: who played for seven teams in a 12 - year major league career
column29: has died . He was 45 . 	 Jonathan India finished ahead of Cardinals OF Dylan Carlson and Marlins starter Trevor Rogers .

column1: NEW YORK --   One rocket - armed rookie gets hurt
column2: the New York Mets simply turn to another . 	 Pretty nice to have all that young pitching . 	 Noah Syndergaard struck out a career - high 13 in eight overpowering innings
column3: and New York got consecutive homers from slumping sluggers Lucas Duda and Michael Cuddyer to beat the Arizona Diamondbacks 4 - 2 on Friday night . 	 " I was able to just relax and go right after guys
column4: " Syndergaard said . " The ability to change speeds and keep them off balance was the reason for my success . " 	 Hours after teammate Steven Matz went on the disabled list with wins in both big league starts
column5: Syndergaard ( 4 - 4 ) gave the Mets and their stingy rotation a major boost . He gave up a sacrifice fly in the first to All - Star bopper Paul Goldschmidt and then dominated the Diamondbacks
column6: allowing only one run for the third consecutive start . 	 The 6 - foot-6
column7: 242 - pound rookie from Texas walked off to a warm ovation from the crowd of 28
column8: 243 . 	 " He 's pitching good right now and he knows it
column9: " Mets manager Terry Collins said . " His last three have been tremendous . ... He 's grown fast . " 	 Syndergaard whiffed Goldschmidt twice and threw 116 pitches
column10: most by a Mets starter this season . The 22 - year - old righty with the blazing fastball yielded four hits and walked two
column11: reaching double digits in strikeouts for the third time in 11 career games . 	 Every member of Arizona 's starting lineup struck out at least once . 	 " He located pretty much every off - speed pitch where he wanted to throw it
column12: " said All - Star outfielder A.J. Pollock
column13: who doubled and scored in the first . " You do that with 98 ( mph ) in the tank and you have a hitter thinking that
column15: he might rear back and throw 98
column16: it 's just tough to hit . " 	 Jeurys Familia allowed Welington Castillo 's RBI single before securing his 25th save in 27 attempts . 	 After a single by Ruben Tejada and a two - out walk to Wilmer Flores in the first
column17: Duda drove a 2 - 0 pitch from Chase Anderson ( 4 - 3 ) over the 408 - foot sign in straightaway center field for a three - run shot . The ball smacked off the black batter 's eye just below the well that houses the home run apple at Citi Field . column1: MIAMI --   Mike Leake 's final pitch Friday sent All - Star Dee Gordon spinning into the dirt with an awkward swing and a miss for strike three . 	 " I guess he just does n't see my pitches too well
column2: " Leake said . 	 Ditto the rest of the Miami Marlins . Leake allowed three hits in eight innings and had a season - high 10 strikeouts to help the Cincinnati Reds beat Miami 1 - 0 . 	 Jay Bruce 's homer leading off the second inning accounted for the lone run . 	 " Vintage Mike Leake
column3: " Bruce said . " To cash in on his performance was something we wanted to do . He pitched great . " 	 Leake ( 6 - 5 ) walked one and threw 102 pitches . Gordon
column4: who leads the majors with 119 hits
column5: struck out a season - high three times against the right - hander
column6: each time on three pitches . 	 " We 're going to have to figure out Mr. Leake so we 'll be able to get him next time
column7: " Gordon said . " He definitely pitched a great game . " 	 Leake improved to 5 - 1 in six career starts against the Marlins with an ERA of 1.33 . 	 All - Star Aroldis Chapman gave up a single to Adeiny Hechavarria on a 103 - mph fastball in the ninth but struck out the side to earn his 18th save in 19 chances . 	 Bruce 's 13th homer was the only run allowed by David Phelps ( 4 - 5 )
column8: who pitched six innings . 	 " That was a tremendous pitchers ' duel
column9: " Marlins manager Dan Jennings said . " Phelps threw the ball outstanding . Unfortunately
column10: Leake maxed him and had an outstanding cutter going . He 's tough to square up . The kid 's a tremendous athlete . " 	 The Marlins went 0 for 4 with runners in scoring position . Their final threat against Leake came in the eighth when Casey McGehee
column11: signed before the game to rejoin Miami
column12: had a pinch - hit double with two outs . Gordon then struck out to end the inning . 	 " I had conviction in my pitches
column13: " Leake said . " That 's key for me . The only bad miss I had was when I tried to overthrow a little bit with McGehee
column14: and he made me pay . " 	 Justin Bour and Michael Morse each had three of the Marlins ' 13 strikeouts . 	 Miami and Cincinnati have combined to score three runs while splitting the first two games of the series . The Marlins have struggled to score without injured slugger Giancarlo Stanton

column16: who went 2 for 3
column17: was batting .162 on May 15 but is now at.244 . 	 " It was a hole that I had to dig myself out of
column18: and there 's still a lot of work to do
column19: " he said . " I 'm still not even close to where I want to be . " 	 REMEMBERING STABLER 	 Jennings was a friend of former Oakland Raiders quarterback Ken Stabler

column2: Fla. --   Erasmo Ramirez supported his strong pitching with a key defensive play in the second inning . 	 Ramirez pitched six innings of four - hit ball and likely saved two runs when he backed up third base and retrieved a wild throw from center fielder Kevin Kiermaier in the Tampa Bay Rays ' 3 - 1 victory over the Houston Astros on Friday night . 	 " I just used instinct
column4: who won for the sixth time in seven starts and helped the Rays snap a four - game losing streak . " It was a good time to back up the bases . If the ball bounces into the stands
column5: they 're both going to score . " 	 Ramirez had given up a solo homer to Colby Rasmus in the inning and then walked Cris Carter . When Jason Castro followed with a single
column6: Kiermaier threw wildly over third base as both runners moved up . 	 " That ended up being a huge play because definitely if he 's not there
column8: " Rays manager Kevin Cash said . 	 Ramirez ( 8 - 3 ) struck out Jake Marisnick to end the threat and the Astros never scored again
column9: losing for the sixth time in seven games . 	 Relievers Jake McGee
column10: Kevin Jepsen and Brad Boxberger helped Ramirez limit the Astros to two runners over the final seven innings . Boxberger got the last three outs for his 21st save . 	 " It 's good when all three of us throw because usually when all three of us throw
column13: who had not pitched in a week . The left - hander 's 1 1/3 innings marked his longest appearance since last August 24 and his 16th straight scoreless appearance . 	 The Astros have scored only four runs while losing four straight . 	 " We 've got to find a way to get out of this
column14: " Astros manager A.J. Hinch said . " Our starters are throwing the ball well enough to have better outcomes for them . We 'll figure it out . . . It can be a cruel league sometimes when you 're having a tough time scoring . " 	 Brandon Guyer homered in the seventh for the Rays
column15: who have won only twice in their last 13 games . It was his third homer of the season and his first since May 8 . Houston starter Collin McHugh ( 9 - 5 ) retired 13 straight batters before Rene Rivera opened the sixth with a single and John Jaso followed with a double . column1: MINNEAPOLIS -- Brian Dozier lost the All - Star Final Vote
column2: then won the game . 	 Dozier hit a three - run homer in the bottom of the ninth to cap a seven - run rally and give the Minnesota Twins an 8 - 6 victory over the Detroit Tigers on Friday night . 	 After missing out on an All - Star nomination in the final player vote earlier in the day
column3: Dozier had two hits and four RBIs
column4: and hit his second game - winning homer of the week . Dozier homered off Detroit closer Joakim Soria ( 3 - 1 )
column5: who blew his third save in 23 chances . 	 " The one a few days ago only went about five rows up
column6: " Dozier said . " So once I hit it
column7: I knew it was gone . So I looked to the dugout
column8: then I looked back to left just to make sure . I second - guessed myself there for a second . " 	 The Twins scored seven times in the ninth off Soria and Bruce Rondon after being limited to one run by Justin Verlander
column9: who went 7⅔ innings . 	 " You have to be ready for the game in any situation . Whatever the score is
column10: you have to be mentally ready for the game
column12: who was n't warming up at the beginning of the inning . " Feel badly because Verlander threw a nice game and I blew it . It 's part of baseball
column14: the ball goes like that . " 	 Trevor May ( 6 - 7 ) pitched a scoreless ninth
column15: giving up two hits . 	 Dozier was part of the American League 's final player vote for the All - Star Game and found out before the game he finished second to Kansas City third baseman Mike Moustakas . 	 Dozier -- who entered Friday tied with Toronto All - Star Josh Donaldson for the most extra - base hits in the majors -- hit a game - winning home run in the ninth on Monday after finding out he did n't make the All - Star team on the first balloting . 	 " Dozier right now is definitely our MVP
column16: " Twins outfielder Torii Hunter said . " He 's doing everything he can to will this team to win
column17: and it showed tonight . " 	 Dozier 's RBI single in the eighth chased Verlander
column18: who had the best outing of his truncated season . 	 Eddie Rosario had an RBI single in the ninth
column19: Kurt Suzuki was hit by a pitch with the bases loaded
column20: and Danny Santana drove in two runs with a single before Dozier 's 19th home run of the season . 	 " We just strung everything together
column21: " Dozier said . " I feel like it happened so quickly ; bam
column23: bam and we win the game . That 's a good thing about this team ; we never feel like we 're out of it . " 	 Verlander held Minnesota to five hits and one run while striking out six in his fifth start off the disabled list . 	 In his first four outings this season
column24: Verlander had allowed 17 earned runs in 22⅔ innings . He looked in vintage form against his longtime rivals in the Central

column26: I told you guys my stuff is much better
column27: " Verlander said . " Felt like I was real close . Tonight was much better than last time . " 	 Yoenis Cespedes had three hits

column29: for Detroit . Victor Martinez and J.D. Martinez added home runs for the Tigers . In seven games without the injured Miguel Cabrera

column1: DENVER --   A hastily constructed group filled in admirably to help the Colorado Rockies ' rotation handle an injury - caused gap . 	 Carlos Gonzalez homered and Colorado leaned on a pitcher by committee approach that featured two newcomers in a 5 - 3 victory over the Atlanta Braves on Friday night . 	 Daniel Descalso had a run - scoring triple to break a career - long 0 - for-20 skid
column2: and Nolan Arenado and D.J. LeMahieu added RBI doubles for the Rockies
column3: who have won their last four games against the Braves
column4: their longest streak ever against Atlanta . 	 Kelly Johnson of the Braves connected for his ninth homer
column5: a three - run shot in the sixth inning and Cameron Maybin singled in the sixth to extend his hitting streak to a career - high tying 10 games . 	 Gonzalez Germen
column6: claimed off waivers from the Chicago Cubs earlier this week
column7: was added to the big league roster and made his first major league start in place of injured David Hale . On a 45 - pitch limit
column8: Germen was lifted after three scoreless innings in favor of Aaron Laffey
column9: whose contract was selected earlier in the day by the Rockies from their Triple - A affiliate in Albuquerque . 	 Laffey ( 1 - 0 ) went 2 1/3 innings
column10: allowing four hits and three runs
column11: all on Johnson 's homer . John Axford
column12: the last of the Rockies ' six pitchers
column13: got three outs for his 16th save in 17 chances . 	 " It was awesome
column14: " Carlos Gonzalez said . " Germen just showed up today
column15: did n't even get to say ` Hi
column16: ' to anybody . He threw three really great innings and gave us a chance . Our bullpen did really good
column17: and Laffey
column18: too . The home run
column19: it was a good pitch away Kelly Johnson was able to stay back and hit it to left . Whenever that happens you just have to tip your cap . But everybody else showed up and we shut them down . " 	 Shelby Miller ( 5 - 5 )
column20: the Braves ' lone NL All - Star
column21: lost a career - high fourth straight decision . He allowed five runs
column23: 11 hits and struck out seven . He remains winless in his last 10 starts despite a 3.31 ERA in that span and entered with an overall ERA of 2.07
column24: which was third - lowest in the majors . 	 " This is the worst my fastball command has been all year . It 's not even close
column25: " Miller said . " My ratio of good fastballs was 50 - 50 . I probably threw more balls with my fastball . I did n't get ahead in the count . Just left balls over the middle of the plate . Everything was up . Just a terrible day . " 	 Descalso 's RBI triple triggered a three - run fourth inning . Brandon Barnes followed with a single
column26: and then was caught stealing
column27: Charlie Blackmon tripled and scored on LeMahieu 's double which hit the warning track and bounced into the stands . 	 Leading off the fifth
column28: Gonzalez jumped on the first pitch he saw from Miller
column29: and drove it to straightaway center into the evergreeens beyond the wall for his 12th home run . 	 " It was away
column30: it was one of those little CarGo reaches
column31: " Gonzalez said . " When things go good
column32: I can cover a lot of the plate
column33: so I was able to put the barrel on the ball and drive it to centerfield . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Braves : LHP Josh Outman
column34: on the 60 - day DL with thoracic outlet syndrome
column35: allowed one hit in one inning with a strikeout in his first minor league rehab outing for the Gulf Coast Braves . The disorder stems from compression of blood vessels or nerves in the cavity between the collarbone and the top rib
column36: which can lead to shoulder pain and finger numbness . 	 Rockies : RHP David Hale pitched 1 2/3 innings of scoreless relief Thursday against Atlanta before leaving with a left groin strain . 	 UP NEXT 	 Braves : Rookie RHP Matt Wisler ( 3 - 1 ) helped snap Milwaukee 's eight - game winning streak in his last start and will look to cool off the Rockies on Saturday as the teams continue a four - game series . 	 Rockies : LHP Jorge De La Rosa ( 6 - 3 ) is 5 - 1 with a 3.14 ERA over his last seven starts despite dealing with a small cut on the middle finger of his pitching hand for much of that time . column1: SEATTLE --   Mike Trout continued his recent power surge and got a little unexpected long - ball help from C.J. Cron . 	 Trout and Cron each homered twice
column2: Hector Santiago survived a shaky start
column3: and the Los Angeles Angels beat the Seattle Mariners 7 - 3 on Friday night . 	 Trout 's three - run homer in the third inning off Mike Montgomery ( 4 - 3 ) erased a 1 - 0 deficit . He opened the seventh with another
column4: tying him for the league lead at 26 with teammate Albert Pujols . 	 " He 's had good numbers
column5: " Trout said of Montgomery . " Our approach is go out there and look for a pitch
column6: look for a pitch over the middle of the plate and not try to miss it . We barreled up some balls
column7: worked some good counts and we just came out with a ` W ' . " 	 In his last 23 games since June 15
column8: Trout is batting .346 with eight home runs
column10: who was twice sent to the minors this season
column11: opened the fourth with his fourth home run and then hit the first pitch from reliever Danny Farquhar for a two - run shot in the sixth to make it 6 - 1 . 	 " Sometimes you 're not seeing the ball well and sometimes you are
column12: so you 've got really capitalize on the time when you 're going well
column14: who is batting .448 since being recalled June 29 . " And
column15: I 'm glad it 's coming when we 're winning some ball games . " 	 Mark Trumbo hit a two - run homer for Seattle in the ninth off Vinnie Pestano
column16: called up from Triple - A Salt Lake earlier in the day . 	 The Angels won for the sixth time in seven games to pull within a half - game of first - place Houston in the AL West . The Astros lost to Tampa Bay 3 - 1
column17: their fourth straight defeat . 	 Santiago ( 6 - 4 )
column18: who escaped the first inning allowing one run despite three hits
column19: struck out seven and walked none in seven innings . 	 " Run support is always a plus
column21: " You do n't change your game plan
column22: you just want to go out there and dominate . You do n't want to look at the scoreboard . Your goal is to put up as many zeroes as you can . " 	 Montgomery
column23: who had allowed just one run in 23 2/3 innings in his last three starts
column24: was tagged for five runs and eight hits in five innings . 	 " I really thought I threw the ball well
column25: " Montgomery said . " You really do n't want to let certain guys beat you . Given that
column26: the pitch to Trout really was a difference maker . If there is one guy you do n't want to let beat you
column27: it 's him . " 	 Trout put the Angels up 3 - 1 in the third with his 25th homer . Johnny Giavotella doubled with one out and Kole Calhoun was hit by a pitch . Trout then lined a 1 - 0 pitch deep over the wall in center field . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM : 	 Angels : Closer Huston Street

column37: " Jackson said . With the additional time off with the pending All - Star break

column39: then I 'll play him

column1: LOS ANGELES --   The Dodgers were held in check by Milwaukee 's Jimmy Nelson until they got a huge break and made the most if it
column2: which is what first - place teams generally do . 	 Pinch - hitter Andre Ethier had a tying two - run single in the seventh inning
column3: rookie Joc Pederson drove in the go - ahead run moments later with a double
column4: and the NL West leaders beat the Brewers 3 - 2 Friday night . 	 Nelson ( 6 - 9 ) took a 2 - 0 lead and a two - hitter into the seventh inning . Hernan Perez
column5: who replaced Aramis Ramirez at third at the start of the inning
column6: booted a two - out grounder by Alex Guerrero
column7: and Jimmy Rollins singled to put runners at the corners . 	 " I do n't think anyone really realized at the time what the error meant
column8: but definitely you could feel that it was maybe our break
column10: and Ethier followed with his broken - bat single to center on a 2 - 2 breaking ball while batting for reliever Chin - hui Tsao ( 1 - 0 ) . 	 " We did n't do a great job of waiting out the right pitch to hit early in the game
column11: " Ethier said . " But we finally got a little break there with that error
column12: and Jimmy came up with a big hit that propelled us to get away with three runs in that inning . " 	 Pederson followed with an opposite - field drive into the left field corner to bring home Ethier . 	 " There were two outs
column13: so I still had a chance to get out of that with no runs . That 's why I 'm being pretty hard on myself right now
column14: " Nelson said . " There 's no excuse for me not getting one of the next two guys
column15: so I feel bad about that part . " 	 No one in the Brewers ' clubhouse felt worse than Perez
column16: who has been used as a late - inning defensive replacement by manager Craig Counsell on a regular basis for the past month . 	 " I tried to get the ball from my glove to my bare hand
column17: but I missed the grip and I did n't have it
column18: " Perez said . " I feel bad about it because Jimmy threw a great game
column19: but that 's part of baseball . I hope I get an opportunity to make that play . " 	 Tsao earned his first victory as a Dodger with a scoreless seventh . J.P. Howell pitched the eighth and Kenley Jansen got three outs for his 15th save in 16 attempts . 	 Dodgers starter Mike Bolsinger allowed two runs and four hits in six innings and struck out six before he was lifted for a pinch - hitter with a 2 - 0 deficit . It was the first time the right - hander went six innings since his last victory on June 8 against Arizona . In six starts since then
column20: he is 0 - 3 with a 4.55 ERA . 	 The Brewers opened the scoring in the fifth with two runs that ended a string of 24 consecutive scoreless innings by the Dodgers ' pitching staff . 	 Jean Segura and Scooter Gennett opened the inning with singles
column21: and both runners advanced on the first of two wild pitches that inning by Bolsinger . Segura scored on Gerardo Parra 's groundout and Gennett came home on another pitch in the dirt that deflected off Yasmani Grandal . 	 The Dodgers threatened in the bottom of the fifth when Grandal was hit by a pitch
column22: stole second and continued to third on Jonathan Lucroy 's throwing error . But Nelson struck out Guerrero and got Rollins on a flyball to center field . 	 Nelson walked Grandal and Yasiel Puig with one out in the second
column23: then got behind Guerrero 2 - 0 and got a visit from pitching coach Rick Kranitz before Guerrero grounded into a double play on a 3 - 1 sinker . 	 " I 'm primarily a sinkerball guy
column24: so we knew in that situation I was one pitch away from getting out of the inning
column25: " Nelson said . " I stuck to my strength and just tried to force contact . " 	 The Dodgers did n't get their first hit until Pederson lined a clean single to right field with one out in the sixth . Howie Kendrick followed with a bouncing single off Nelson 's glove and Justin Turner grounded into a force at second before Adrian Gonzalez flied out to right field . 	 Pederson
column26: heading to his first All - Star game
column27: next week despite an NL - worst 104 strikeouts
column28: fanned his first two times up against Nelson -- slamming his bat in frustration on the second one after a swing and a miss . He is batting .177 with three solo homers
column29: eight RBI and 40 Ks in 109 at - bats . 	 KERSHAW SNUBBED AGAIN 	 Unless he gets added to the NL All - Star roster at the last minute because of an injury to someone
column30: Kershaw will sit this one out after making the team in each of the previous four years . The reigning MVP and three - time Cy Young winner finished third in the internet voting for the final roster spot behind Cardinals RHP Carlos Martinez and Reds RHP Johnny Cueto . 	 " I thought I deserved to be there
column31: but it did n't work out
column32: " Kershaw said . " You always want to go to All - Star Game so
column34: there 's a little disappointment there . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Brewers : Rookie RHP Taylor Jungmann ( 3 - 1 ) will make his seventh career start after going 2 - 0 with a 2.52 ERA in his previous four . 	 Dodgers : RHP Brandon Beachy will make his first start and appearance in the majors since Aug. 20

column2: Mo. --   Danny Duffy 's fastball was too much for the Toronto Blue Jays ' power hitters . 	 Duffy pitched six sharp innings to pick up his first victory in more than two months as the Kansas City Royals beat the Jays 3 - 0 Friday night . 	 Duffy ( 3 - 4 ) shut down a Blue Jays offense which leads the majors with 470 runs . He gave up four singles while walking three and hitting a batter to earn his first victory since beating Detroit on April 30 . 	 " I was n't really executing a whole lot
column3: but my fastball was good enough to get in on guys and riding a little bit
column4: " Duffy said . " With the life I had on my fastball
column5: I was able to get a couple of first pitch ground outs
column6: a couple of more than I 'm used to getting . 	 " That 's the way I needed to pitch . With how much thump they have and how many good hitters they have
column8: put a little sink on it
column9: try to get them to roll over it and they did tonight . " 	 The Royals have won six straight to improve to an American League - best 51 - 34 . 	 " Duffy maneuvered through a real tough lineup
column10: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . 	 Eric Hosmer went 4 for 4
column11: his first four - hit game of the season and his eighth career game with at least four hits . Salvador Perez
column12: Alex Rios and Alcides Escobar each had two hits and an RBI . 	 Blue Jays right - hander Marco Estrada ( 6 - 5 )
column13: who did not allow a hit until the eighth inning in two late June starts
column14: gave up a season - high nine hits . 	 " It 's a long season and I know that a lot of times it 's going to feel like the changeup 's not there
column15: " Estrada said . " I 've just got to fight through it and work hard to get it back to the way it should be .   I think I 'm on the right path . " 	 The Blue Jays
column16: 3 - 7 in July
column17: dropped below .500 for the first time since June 8 . 	 Rios ' double in the second scored Salvador Perez with the first run . 	 Escobar 's two - out fourth inning single brought home Rios to make it 2 - 0 . 	 Perez homered
column18: his 15th
column19: in the eighth off reliever Ryan Tepera . 	 Duffy was in trouble only in the fourth when he walked Danny Valencia and Russell Martin singled to begin the inning
column20: but Duffy retired the next three batters . 	 " You could probably say he was effectively wild
column21: " Jays manager John Gibbons said . " He 's got a good arm .   He clutched up and made good pitches when he needed
column22: good changeups .   We had those chances
column23: but it just did n't happen . " 	 After Duffy exited
column25: Wade Davis and Greg Holland completed the shutout . Holland struck out the side in the ninth for his 18th save in 20 opportunities . 	 Rain delayed the beginning of the game for 2 hours
column26: 7 minutes . 	 ROYALS RECORD 	 The Royals ' 51 victories before the break matches a club record . The 1976 and 2003 clubs also won 51 before the All - Star Game . column1: SAN FRANCISCO -- Hunter Pence 's enthusiasm for the game was missed during a recent offensive drought . It seems to be contagious now . 	 Pence hit a grand slam as part of an eight - run fourth inning against former All - Star Cole Hamels
column2: and the San Francisco Giants beat the Philadelphia Phillies 15 - 2 on Friday night . 	 " I 've played with him long enough to know not to be surprised
column3: " All - Star pitcher Madison Bumgarner said . " He 's that good and he 's fun to watch . " 	 Pence is hitting .400 ( 8 - for-20 ) since returning to the lineup and has seven RBI over his past five games . He has 20 RBI in 21 games overall . 	 Joe Panik
column4: Justin Maxwell and Matt Duffy each recorded four hits
column5: the first time a trio of Giants have accomplished the feat since Tom Haller
column6: Jesus Alou and Hal Lanier did it on May 22
column7: 1965 . 	 " We have been looking for this for a while
column9: who had three hits and drove in two . " It was a fun night . We got the pitches we wanted and there was no chasing . Hamels is a really good pitcher . We just had good at - bats . " 	 Panik
column10: Maxwell and Duffy combined to hit .750 ( 12 - for-16 )
column11: and drive in seven runs on a homer
column12: triple and two doubles . Maxwell was a home run shy of the cycle . Duffy set a career high as the Giants accumulated 22 hits
column13: their most in AT&T Park history . 	 " It was time for us to break out at some point
column14: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " You do n't ever expect to score this many runs
column15: especially going against Cole Hamels . We had guys struggling who had great big at - bats . " 	 Bumgarner ( 9 - 5 ) went 5 2/3 innings
column16: allowing two runs on eight hits . He failed to finish six innings in back - to - back starts for the first time this season . 	 Bumgarner
column17: who received more run support than his last five starts combined
column18: had a pair of hits and drove in a run . He leads all pitchers with 10 hits . 	 " We swung the bats today as good as we can swing the bats
column19: " Bumgarner said . " It was fun watching my guys play good baseball . " 	 Bumgarner and Hamels were the first former World Series MVPs to meet in four years . 	 Hamels ( 5 - 7 ) got the first out of the fourth and then surrendered seven hits and walked a batter before Jake Diekman came in to finish the inning . 	 Brandon Belt doubled
column20: Maxwell walked and Bumgarner singled to load the bases ahead of a two - run single from Pagan . Panik singled to re - load the bases before Duffy singled home two more runs . Buster Posey singled ahead of Pence 's slam . 	 " The moment it left my hand I knew it was n't going to be good
column21: " Hamels said . " I was hoping he 'd miss it or foul it back . But with the strength he has
column22: you know the writing on the wall . " 	 It was Hamel 's shortest outing since going three innings on Sept. 8
column23: 2011 . The nine earned runs were a career high and the 12 hits allowed matched his career worst . 	 Carlos Ruiz homered and Domonic Brown drove in a run for the Phillies
column24: who have lost 13 of 16 on the heels of a three - game winning streak June 21 - 23 . He gave up two earned runs on four hits over 3 2/3 innings in his first rehab start Tuesday . 	 Giants : Right - handers Tim Hudson and Tim Lincecum each pitched a bullpen session . Left - hander Jeremy Affeldt also threw a bullpen and is scheduled for another on Sunday . 	 TIME FOR A DIP : 	 Panik 's two - run homer in the seventh bounced into McCovey 's Cove

column2: Mo. --   All the Toronto Blue Jays needed to break out of a skid was an impressive outing by Mark Buehrle and two big swings . 	 Buehrle pitched seven strong innings
column3: Edwin Encarnacion hit a two - run homer and the Blue Jays beat Kansas City 6 - 2 Saturday to snap the Royals ' six - game winning streak . 	 Buehrle ( 10 - 5 ) limited the Royals to two runs and five hits while improving to 4 - 0 with a 1.24 ERA in his past four starts against them . It was Buehrle 's 26th victory over the Royals . Only Hall of Famer Bert Blyleven ( 34 ) has more wins against the Royals . 	 " He continues to roll
column4: on a tough day to pitch
column5: " Blue Jays manager John Gibbons said . " It was hot out there . The offense came to life . We do what we do with a couple of home runs ; that was the difference there . Buehrle was really good . They put a run up early and he kicked it up a notch . " 	 Encarnacion 's 18th home run in the fourth inning off Chris Young ended the Blue Jays ' 27 - inning scoring drought . 	 " If the pitch was executed a little bit better
column6: it might have been a pop up
column7: " Young said . " The next at - bat I threw a better slider and he popped it up . It was a mistake . I did n't make too many mistakes today . It 's a bad feeling as a pitcher
column8: letting the team down with one pitch . I felt like I executed most of my pitches to give us a chance
column9: but again Buehrle was just better today . " 	 Toronto led 3 - 2 in the ninth when Danny Valencia
column10: traded by the Royals to the Blue Jays last July 28
column11: hit a three - run homer off rookie Brandon Finnegan to extend the advantage . 	 " Obviously I played here last year
column12: but we needed a win and I wanted to help the team
column13: " Valencia said . 	 Jose Reyes had three hits
column16: scored a run and drove in a run for the Blue Jays . 	 Young ( 7 - 5 )
column17: working on three days ' rest
column18: gave up three runs and five hits with two walks in six - plus innings . He left after giving up a single to Kevin Pillar to open the inning . 	 The Royals took a 1 - 0 lead in the first as Alcides Escobar doubled
column19: moved to third on a sacrifice and scored on Kendrys Morales ' grounder . It gave Morales 10 RBI in his past 11 games
column20: and 57 on the season . 	 The Royals had Alex Rios at third and Omar Infante at second with one out in the second
column21: but Buehrle held them there by striking out Drew Butera and getting Jarrod Dyson on a ground out . 	 Encarnacion 's homer in the fourth gave the Blue Jays the lead for good
column22: and Reyes had a run - scoring infield single in seventh to make it 3 - 1 . 	 Rios led off the bottom of the seventh with a double
column23: moved to third on a fly ball to center and scored on Paulo Orlando 's grounder to pull the Royals within a run again . 	 SEEING 10s 	 Buehrle has won 10 or more games in 15 straight seasons
column24: the longest active streak in the majors .   " That 's what he does
column25: " Gibbons said . " I hate to see him retire because he does n't seem to show any signs of slowing down . " Buehrle is 5 - 1 with a 1.88 ERA in his past nine starts . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Blue Jays : 3B Josh Donaldson left in the sixth inning after three at - bats with flu - like symptoms . He was replaced by Valencia . 	 Royals : RHP Kris Medlen ( rehabbing from 2014 reconstructive elbow surgery ) allowed three runs

column1: MINNEAPOLIS --   After a stirring comeback the night before
column2: the Minnesota Twins brought the good feelings and big swings back for another victory over the Detroit Tigers . 	 Momentum
column3: Minnesota . 	 Torii Hunter 's towering two - run homer into the third deck against his former team highlighted a 16 - hit afternoon for the Twins in a 9 - 5 win over the Tigers on Saturday . 	 " You 've got to have kids in college to do that
column5: as his son and Notre Dame wide receiver
column7: sat next to him in the clubhouse . 	 Trevor Plouffe and Eddie Rosario each had three hits and scored twice
column8: and the bottom five batters in Minnesota 's lineup combined for six RBI and 11 hits in 19 at - bats . Aaron Hicks hit a two - run triple in the third inning that finished another rough start for Tigers right - hander Alfredo Simon . 	 Twins manager Paul Molitor said before the game he felt a buzz at the ballpark
column9: after Brian Dozier 's game - ending home run on Friday against Joakim Soria capped a seven - run ninth inning in an 8 - 6 victory . column1: DENVER --   Carlos Gonzalez 's towering home run made an impression . His fly ball to shallow center made the difference . 	 Gonzalez hit a bases - loaded bloop single that dropped between charging center fielder Cameron Maybin and backpedaling shortstop Andrelton Simmons in the ninth inning Saturday
column2: driving in the decisive run in the Colorado Rockies ' 3 - 2 victory over the Atlanta Braves . 	 " I knew it had a chance " to fall in
column4: just good enough to get the winning run . I 'll take that every day . " 	 Misfortune befell the Braves at the outset of the rally by the Rockies
column5: who have won their last five games against Atlanta . 	 Reliever Jason Grilli ( 3 - 4 ) tumbled to the ground and suffered a ruptured left Achilles ' tendon as he ran toward first to cover the bag when Drew Stubbs
column7: hit a grounder that first baseman Chris Johnson ranged to his right to field . 	 Grilli appeared to take a bad step and crumpled to the ground
column8: grabbing his lower left leg in pain . Stubbs was safe on what was ruled a hit . Team trainers and manager Fredi Gonzalez ran on to the field to tend to Grilli
column9: who remained on the ground for several minutes . He was helped to his feet
column10: taken away on a cart for further treatment and replaced by David Aardsma . 	 The team said in a tweet after the game that Grilli was expected to miss the rest of the season . 	 " The pain he was in on the field was cruel
column11: " Fredi Gonzalez said . 	 Charlie Blackmon was hit by a pitch and after Nolan Arenado struck out
column12: Troy Tulowitzki walked to load the bases . Gonzalez
column13: who hit a towering drive that cleared the center field wall earlier
column14: lofted a fly ball to shallow center that the Braves simply could n't get to before it fell with Stubbs coming in to score the winning run . 	 " I had three strikeouts going into that at bat so I 'm just trying to find a way to get on base
column15: to get the next guy up and to help us win a ball game
column16: " said Tulowitzki
column17: who learned after the game that he had been named to his fifth All Star game as an injury replacement . " Sure enough
column18: I did that
column19: and we got some luck on that last play . " 	 Tulowitzki went hitless on the day
column20: snapping his career - long 21 game hitting streak . But he reached base with the walk
column21: and now has reached base in a career high 37 straight games . 	 " The history was fun while it lasted
column23: referring to the end of his hitting streak
column24: which was the longest in the majors this season . " My teammates had fun with it . I had a good time with it . " 	 LaTroy Hawkins ( 2 - 1 ) pitched a scoreless ninth for the victory . 	 The Braves loaded the bases with one out in the eighth but could n't convert against reliever Christian Friedrich
column25: who induced Simmons to fly out to shallow center and struck out Ryan Lavarnway
column26: who homered earlier . 	 " We had opportunities
column27: " Jonny Gomes said after the Braves lost their fourth in a row
column28: including three to the Rockies heading into Sunday 's series finale . " It 's an interesting ballpark . They hit some triples over our head . Blooped some in . column29: two run homer that soared into the stand of evergreens beyond the center field wall . Gonzalez hit a homer to nearly the same place the night before . He 'll be followed by Manny Banuelos
column30: Shelby Miller

column1: MIAMI --   The Miami Marlins lost All - Star second baseman Dee Gordon to a dislocated left thumb Saturday
column2: and took out their aggravation on the Cincinnati Reds with a franchise - record offensive outburst . 	 Gordon was hurt leading off the seventh inning when he slid headfirst into first base for an infield single
column3: the first of a record nine consecutive hits as Miami won 14 - 3 . 	 Gordon will miss the All - Star Game but might be sidelined only a week or two . X - rays were negative
column4: and there was no apparent ligament damage
column5: the Marlins said . 	 After Gordon left the game
column6: Miami scored eight runs in the seventh . J.T. Realmuto hit a three - run homer
column7: Christian Yelich had a double and a single
column8: and reliever Mike Dunn singled for his first hit in seven seasons . 	 " I looked up after I got the X - ray and saw Dunn 's hit
column10: ` Dunn ? ! ' It was cool . We needed that
column12: who leads the majors with 122 hits
column13: was chosen to start in the All - Star Game for the first time . With right fielder Giancarlo Stanton already sidelined because of a broken left hand
column14: Gordon 's injury means the Marlins will have no players at the All - Star Game . 	 " It kind of puts a damper a big day for us
column15: " manager Dan Jennings said . 	 The Marlins had a season - high 21 hits
column16: including three infield singles by Gordon . Their run total was a season high after they had scored just 12 runs in the past seven games . 	 Miami 's 10 hits in the seventh tied the team record for an inning . It was the most in an inning allowed by Cincinnati since 1961 . 	 " That was some damage
column17: " Reds manager Bryan Price said . " I do n't think I 've ever seen nine consecutive hits before . " 	 Yelich
column18: Realmuto and Cole Gillespie finished with three hits each . Gillespie hit his first home run of the year and made a running over - the - shoulder basket catch with his back to the plate in center field to rob Marlon Byrd . 	 Casey McGehee
column19: making his first start after signing Friday for a second stint with Miami
column20: had two hits and drove in two runs . 	 Rookie Adam Conley ( 1 - 0 ) went five innings to earn his first major league victory in his first start . Following the spot start
column21: he was optioned back to Triple - A New Orleans . 	 Raisel Iglesias ( 1 - 2 ) allowed five runs in 4 1/3 innings . He had been sidelined with a strained left oblique and was activated before the game from the disabled list . 	 Manny Parra gave up five runs in the seventh without retiring a batter . His ERA rose from 1.65 to 4.41 . 	 " Manny threw the ball over the plate for the most part
column23: " but the quality of his strikes was n't what we 've been used to seeing . " 	 The Marlins finished 11 for 19 with runners in scoring position . 	 " Their pitchers were getting base hits -- that 's how confident they were by the time the smoke cleared
column24: " Price said . 	 Eugenio Suarez hit his fourth home run for the Reds . 	 DELAYED STEAL 	 Major league stolen base leader Billy Hamilton increased his total to 44 by swiping two bases
column25: including one on a delayed steal of third that caught the Marlins in a lackadaisical moment and led to a run . Following a pitch
column26: catcher Realmuto lobbed the ball back to Conley
column27: and Hamilton stole third without a throw . 	 ROTATIONS 	 Reds : Price said he has not determined the order for his rotation after the All - Star break . He said ace Johnny Cueto
column28: who pitches Sunday
column29: will likely throw a side session on Thursday or Friday and pitch in one of next weekend 's games against the Cleveland Indians . Price said he remains confident RHP Anthony DeSclafani will miss only one start . 	 Marlins : RHP Jose Fernandez 's next scheduled start is Friday at Philadelphia

column33: who has been on the DL since June 15

column2: Fla. --   The Tampa Bay Rays got a strong outing from Jake Odorizzi and cashed in on a key early call . 	 Odorizzi won in his first start in five weeks
column3: Rene Rivera drove in two runs and the Rays beat the sliding Houston Astros 3 - 0 on Saturday . 	 " Nice to have Odo back
column4: " Tampa Bay manager Kevin Cash said . 	 Odorizzi ( 5 - 5 ) scattered two hits
column5: walked three and struck out five over 5 2/3 innings in his first appearance since straining his left oblique June 5 . Brad Boxberger
column7: pitched the ninth for his 22nd save to complete a three - hitter . 	 One call that went the Rays ' way in the second led to three runs and a late - game ejection . 	 Jake Elmore drew a two - out walk off Dallas Keuchel to load the bases after he took a pitch earlier in the at - bat that could have been the third strike . Plate umpire Greg Gibson
column9: called it a ball . Rivera then drove in a pair with a single before Brandon Guyer made it 3 - 0 on another single . 	 " Everybody in the ballpark thought it was a strike
column11: " Keuchel said . " That 's a key pitch and I 've got to have that
column12: and I think he knew he missed it because he kind of opened it up after that . " 	 But Keuchel also acknowledged that " obviously I did n't do a good job of letting it go there for the next couple of hitters
column13: and that 's what cost me . " 	 Houston manager A.J. Hinch said the second inning was " the story of the game . " 	 " I have n't looked at the video
column14: but it 's pretty obvious what we thought of it
column15: " he said . 	 Pitching coach Brent Strom was ejected by Gibson during a visit to the mound in the seventh inning . 	 " It 's pretty obvious what happened
column16: " Hinch said . 	 Elmore called the pitch borderline but conceded that " it was too close to take . " He appeared to take a step toward the dugout before the pitch was called a ball . 	 " I 'm glad he stayed in the box
column17: " Cash said . 	 Tampa Bay set a team record with its 11th straight win when the opponent starts a left - hander . 	 Houston has scored just four runs during a five - game losing streak . The surprising Astros took over first place in the AL West on April 19
column18: but they had their lead dwindle to a half - game over the Los Angeles Angels entering Saturday . The Angels were scheduled to play Seattle on Saturday night . 	 Keuchel ( 11 - 4 )
column19: who was bidding to become the AL 's first 12 - game winner
column20: allowed three runs and seven hits in seven innings . It was his 30th consecutive start of six or more innings
column21: which is the majors ' longest active streak . 	 Asdrubal Cabrera scored on Rivera 's hit but strained his right hamstring on the play and needed assistance off the field . Elmore moved in from left field to replace Cabrera at shortstop . 	 Houston loaded the bases with two outs in the fourth but failed to score when Hank Conger fouled out on the first pitch he saw . 	 The Astros had just five hits in a series - opening 3 - 1 loss Friday night . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Astros : Hinch said RHP Scott Feldman ( right knee ) might return next weekend after making two minor league starts . 	 Rays : RF Steven Souza Jr. ( right finger cut ) hit off a tee and could return around July 21 . ... LHP Drew Smyly ( torn labrum ) bounced a number of pitches during his latest bullpen session . 	 SPECIAL SEAT 	 The Rays dedicated a right - field seat at Tropicana Field during a pregame ceremony that will always remain open in remembrance of prisoners of war and those missing in action . 	 UP NEXT 	 Astros : Rookie RHP Lance McCullers ( 4 - 2 )

column1: CLEVELAND --   The Oakland Athletics needed someone to come through with a clutch hit . Billy Butler obliged at a crucial moment . 	 Butler 's two - run double with the bases loaded broke a tie in the eighth inning and Oakland beat the Cleveland Indians 5 - 4 on Saturday night . 	 With two outs
column2: Butler lined an 0 - 1 pitch from Bryan Shaw over first base to snap a 2 - all tie . Right fielder Brandon Moss ' throwing error allowed a third run to score on the play . 	 " Sometimes you need a big hit to help you break out
column3: " Butler said . " We 've been having trouble with that . It has n't been happening for us lately . " 	 Butler was 2 for 8 lifetime off Shaw going into the game . 	 " I 've faced him quite a bit
column4: " Butler said . " It was a really good pitch
column5: down and away . It hit off the end of the bat . I was lucky I found a hole down the line . I could have easily hit that at somebody too . " 	 Eric O'Flaherty ( 1 - 2 ) pitched 2/3 of an inning . Tyler Clippard
column7: recorded the final four outs for his 17th save . 	 Carlos Santana hit a two - run homer in the eighth
column8: but Cleveland 's four - game winning streak ended . 	 All - Star Stephen Vogt started the winning rally with a two - out single off Zach McAllister ( 2 - 3 ) . Marc Rzepczynski gave up a single to Ben Zobrist and walked Josh Reddick . Butler came through with the clutch hit that snapped Oakland 's three - game losing streak . 	 " That was huge
column9: " Oakland manager Bob Melvin said . " We 'll take it
column10: especially scoring a couple of runs like that was big for us . " 	 " Shaw made a real good pitch on a breaking ball to Butler
column11: but you ca n't have a fielder everywhere
column12: " Indians manager Terry Francona said . " It 's what led up to that at - bat that really hurt . We tried to set it up for ( Rzepczynski )
column13: but it did n't work . " 	 Moss ' throw to second base hit Butler in the back and rolled away
column15: a run that turned out to be crucial . 	 " I did n't think Moss was going to be throwing to second
column16: " Butler said . " I had no clue whether that ball was going to be on me or not . That was a bright spot there . We needed that run . " 	 Carlos Carrasco allowed two runs and struck out seven in seven innings . The right - hander is 0 - 1 in two starts since coming within one out of pitching a no - hitter against Tampa Bay on July 1 . 	 Oakland called up Chris Bassitt from Triple - A Nashville to take the rotation spot of right - hander Jesse Hahn
column17: who was placed on the 15 - day disabled list with a strained forearm . The right - hander allowed two runs in 6 1/3 innings . 	 Reddick 's sacrifice fly in the first gave Oakland the lead . Michael Brantley 's RBI single tied the game in the sixth . Ike Davis ' RBI double in the seventh put Oakland on top
column18: but Roberto Perez 's single in the bottom of the inning tied the game again . 	 WHO 'S ON THIRD ? 	 Eric Sogard
column19: playing third base for the first time in three years
column21: including a bunt by Michael Bourn in the third . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Athletics : LHP Scott Kazmir ( left triceps strain ) threw a 50 - pitch bullpen session before the game and reported no problems . He left his last start Wednesday at the Yankees after three innings . 	 Indians : LHP Nick Hagadone ( strained back ) played catch Saturday and could begin a minor league rehab assignment after the All - Star break . He was placed on the 15 - day DL on July 7 . 	 UP NEXT 	 Athletics : RHP Sonny Gray

column23: makes his second start since returning from salmonella poisoning . He allowed three runs in six innings against the Yankees on Tuesday . 	 Indians : RHP Corey Kluber recorded his first win since May 28 when he pitched 6 2/3 scoreless innings against Houston on Tuesday . He 's 0 - 3 in four career appearances ( three starts ) against Oakland . 	 Jonathan India finished ahead of Cardinals OF Dylan Carlson and Marlins starter Trevor Rogers for NL Rookie of the Year . column1: BALTIMORE --   The Washington Nationals appeared to be mired in another offensive funk as the sixth inning began at Camden Yards . 	 Having made 10 straight outs against Baltimore Orioles right - hander Miguel Gonzalez
column2: the Nationals desperately needed a spark to turn things around . 	 Bryce Harper got Washington started with his 26th home run
column3: and Danny Espinoza subsequently added a three - run shot to propel the Nationals to a 7 - 4 victory Saturday night . 	 After Harper 's leadoff homer
column4: Clint Robinson and Wilson Ramos singled before Espinosa sent an 0 - 1 pitch over the 25 - foot scoreboard in right field for a 6 - 4 lead . 	 Though Espinoza 's blow was the difference - maker
column5: Harper provided the impetus for the comeback with a no - doubt drive to right field . 	 " That ball was crushed . Pretty impressive
column6: " Espinosa said . " He seems to do that a lot . " 	 Espinosa was n't sure what he was going to be asked to do when he came to the plate later in the inning . 	 " Thought maybe we would do a sac bunt
column7: " he said . " Definitely a fun situation to be in right there with Bryce having hit the home run and having a couple of guys on base . " 	 It was his 10th home run
column8: second - most on the team behind Harper . 	 Harper 's home run was his first against the Orioles in 12 career games . He 's 8 for 44 ( .182 ) with three RBI against Baltimore
column9: including 5 for 26 at Camden Yards . 	 " I ca n't see ( the ball ) here very well
column10: " Harper said . " I feel it 's a little dark . " 	 Jordan Zimmermann ( 8 - 5 ) won his third straight start despite allowing four runs and nine hits in five innings . He was pitching one day after his wife gave birth to the couple 's second child . 	 " Not a lack of focus
column11: " he insisted . " Just did n't have it tonight . " 	 Caleb Joseph and Steve Pearce homered for the Orioles
column12: who have lost nine of 12 . Baltimore went 0 for 8 with runners in scoring position and is 0 for 15 in that situation over the first two games of the series . 	 " We 're just going through it right now
column14: " Pearce said . " We 've got to try to battle through it
column15: and we 'll do it . " 	 Gonzalez gave up two runs and five hits over the first two innings
column16: then appeared to regain his command before things unraveled in the sixth . 	 " I did n't think he was very sharp tonight early on
column17: " Orioles manager Buck Showalter said . " Miguel
column18: like a lot of good pitchers
column19: kind of found his step in the third
column20: fourth and fifth . But it was n't there for him in the sixth . " 	 Michael Taylor added an RBI single in the ninth for the Nationals
column21: who snapped a three - game skid . It was only the second time in nine games they scored more than three runs . 	 Drew Storen
column23: got three outs for his 26th save . 	 The interleague matchup between neighboring rivals drew 44
column25: the second straight sellout at Camden Yards . The deciding game will be played Sunday before both teams head into the All - Star break . 	 Washington 's first inning ended when Yunel Escobar was thrown out trying to score on a double by Robinson . Jimmy Paredes hit a run - scoring grounder in the bottom half . 	 After the Nationals used a run - scoring grounder and an RBI single by Taylor to go up 2 - 1 in the second
column26: Joseph answered with a two - run drive in the Baltimore half . 	 Pearce made it 4 - 2 in the fourth with his seventh home run
column27: the first since May 27 . 	 Before this game
column28: Zimmermann allowed only one run over 22 2/3 innings . 	 " For sure
column29: it was n't one of my better outings

column1: BOSTON --   New York right - hander Ivan Nova has n't had much offensive support the last three starts . 	 On Saturday
column2: the bullpen did n't help either . 	 Nova left with New York trailing by a run before the bullpen allowed two more to score in Boston 's 5 - 3 victory over the AL East - leading Yankees . 	 Boston led 3 - 2 when Nova was pulled with a runner on second and two outs in the seventh . The Red Sox added two more runs on an RBI triple by Mookie Betts and an infield single by Xander Bogaerts . 	 " We just could n't get that third out
column3: " Yankees manager Joe Girardi said . " I brought in the guys that were very capable of doing it
column4: and they just were n't able to keep it there . " 	 Nova ( 1 - 3 ) allowed four runs and eight hits
column5: striking out three in 6 2/3 innings in his fourth start of the season after missing the first 71 games recovering from Tommy John surgery . 	 " I 've been very pleased the way he 's thrown the ball
column6: " Girardi said . " He 's given us a chance to win every time . " 	 The Yankees scored one run total in his previous two starts . 	 " I felt pretty good the way I threw my cutter today
column7: " he said . " I threw a lot of good pitches . " 	 Alex Rodriguez homered in the first inning for the second straight game
column8: and ex - Boston center fielder Jacoby Ellsbury had three hits
column9: including a home run . 	 Hanley Ramirez hit a two - run homer
column10: Betts had two extra - base hits and David Ortiz had two hits for Boston . 	 The Red Sox won for the 10th time in 13 games . They remained in last place in the East
column11: but they closed to 5 1 - 2 games out in the division . Boston was 10 games out June 20 last year . 	 The Yankees had beaten the Red Sox five straight times
column12: including a 5 - 1 win Friday . But a day after losing the series opener and top starter Clay Buchholz on the same night
column13: the Red Sox got 6 1/3 solid innings from Eduardo Rodriguez ( 5 - 2 ) . 	 The rookie left - hander allowed five hits and a walk while striking out two
column14: leaving with a 3 - 2 lead in the seventh . It was just the third time in nine career starts that he has given up two runs or more . 	 Koji Uehara pitched the ninth for his 22nd save
column15: ending it by getting Brian McCann on a 400 - foot fly ball to center with a man on base . 	 Rodriguez made it 1 - 0 with his 672nd career homer
column16: hitting it over the Green Monster
column17: where it was grabbed by a fan in a " Free ( Tom ) Brady " T - shirt . The Yankees designated hitter was booed by the crowd
column18: but he found a fan in a Yankees jersey in the front row to hand his batting gloves to on the way to the dugout . 	 Boston tied it in the third
column19: then Ortiz singled to lead off the fourth and Ramirez homered to make it 3 - 1 . Ellsbury homered into the Boston bullpen to cut the lead to 3 - 2 . 	 DEBUTED 	 Yankees prospect Rob Refsnyder was hitless in three at - bats
column20: batting ninth in his major - league debut . Refsnyder
column21: who was called up from Triple - A
column22: hit into a double play in the third and was robbed of his first hit in the sixth when Boston RF Alejandro De Aza came in to make a diving catch of his sinking liner . He popped to first in the eighth . 	 " I was n't nervous at all
column23: " he joked . " It was quite an experience
column24: growing up a sports fan in a sports family . It was special . I would have liked to get a hit and help the team win . It 's something I 'll remember . 	 A - ROD CLIMBING 	 Rodriguez 's next hit will tie him with Rafeal Palmeiro for 24th all - time . 	 PEN TROUBLES 	 Adam Warren of the Yankees faced three batters
column25: giving up the triple
column26: single and a walk before he was pulled . 	 UP NEXT 	 Yankees : Nathan Eovaldi ( 8 - 2 ) pitches for the Yankees in the series finale . 	 Red Sox : Wade Miley ( 8 - 7 ) will try to help Boston win its fifth straight series . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Yankees : The Yankees moved OF Mason Williams from the 15 - day to the 60 - day DL to make room for Refsnyder on the 40 - man roster . 	 Red Sox : Buchholz was placed on the 15 - day DL with a strained right elbow a day after leaving his start in the fourth inning . To take his place
column27: the club selected LHP Brian Johnson from Triple - A Pawtucket . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column28: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column29: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: PITTSBURGH --   The Pittsburgh Pirates inched themselves closer to first place
column2: overcoming three deficits and two ejections . 	 Andrew McCutchen 's two - run home run in the 14th inning capped Pittsburgh 's third rally of the night and helped the Pirates beat the St. Louis Cardinals 6 - 5 on Saturday night . 	 McCutchen 's homer to center off of Nick Greenwood ( 0 - 1 ) immediately followed Neil Walker 's leadoff single and extended his hitting streak to a career - high 18 games . It was his 12th home run of the season . 	 " Quite the climactic ending right there . That was a lot of fun
column3: " McCutchen said . " Who would 've thought it would 've came down to that ? " 	 Especially after Jhonny Peralta 's single off Vance Worley ( 3 - 4 ) in the top of the inning drove in Matt Carpenter to give St. Louis a lead . 	 Or after Mark Reynolds hit his second solo homer of the game during the top of the 10th . 	 Or even after Matt Carpenter scored the first of his three runs during the fifth inning to give the Cardinals a 3 - 0 lead . 	 " We had the lead three different times
column4: and that 's something that does n't typically slip away
column5: " St. Louis manager Mike Matheny said . " But today was one of those days . " 	 Pittsburgh scored twice in the eighth on RBI singles by Jung Ho Kang and Pedro Alvarez to tie the game
column6: and Chris Stewart singled in Kang in the 10th . 	 The Pirates have won seven of eight and 10 of 12 . Pittsburgh
column7: which has the NL 's second - best record
column8: lost the first three games of the season series with the Cardinals in extra innings in May. 	 " We had grit all over
column9: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said . " I 'm proud
column10: always been proud of these guys . Tonight was just another example with an exclamation point behind it . Grit
column13: keep playing the game . When something does n't go right
column14: you keep playing the game . " 	 DISPUTED CALL 	 With two outs and nobody on in the second
column15: Reynolds appeared to have struck out -- indeed
column16: television replays showed he swung and missed at a 1 - 2 Burnett curveball . But home plate umpire Vic Carapazza ruled a foul tip . 	 Pirates catcher Francisco Cervelli and Hurdle each briefly argued the call . After the next pitch
column17: however
column18: each became livid . 	 Reynolds homered down the left - field line
column19: his seventh . Cervelli was ejected moments later . Hurdle and coach Brad Fischer came out to argue and restrain an incensed Cervelli . After several minutes of arguing with Carapazza
column20: Hurdle was ejected by him . 	 " If you look at the video
column21: it looks like maybe I got a seam on it or something
column22: " Reynolds said . " I heard something and Vic heard something
column24: and gave me a foul ball
column25: gave me another chance . " 	 Carapazza declined to comment after the game . Crew chief Larry Vanover told a pool reporter that Carapazza made a foul ball call because he heard a tip . The ejection
column26: Vanover said
column27: was due to language . 	 TRIAL BY FIRE 	 The Cardinals announced the recall of pitchers Sam Tuivailala and Greenwood from Triple - A Memphis on Saturday afternoon . Several hours later
column28: both were needed . 	 Tuivailala pitched scoreless 12th and 13th innings
column29: and was in line for the win until Greenwood allowed each of the two batters he faced to reach and
column30: ultimately
column31: score . 	 The Cardinals added an extra arm to their overworked bullpen just for such a scenario . 	 " We knew we had to get someone to get us later in the game and then somebody top throw until it was over
column32: " Matheny said . " And it was Greenwood 's game to throw -- he 's done a nice job at Triple - A for us
column33: and he 's done a nice job in the past . That was a tough spot for him to come into . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Pirates LHP Francisco Liriano has allowed more than three runs in just three of his 17 starts this season . However
column34: that lone occasion came at PNC Park against the Cardinals
column35: whom he will face in a nationally - televised game Sunday night . Pittsburgh has lost both of Liriano 's starts against St. Louis this season . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cardinals : 2B Kolten Wong left the game an inning after being hit by a pitch in the 11th . " His hammy had tightened up because of that hit by pitch so I had to get him out
column36: " Matheny said . " It did n't seem to be anything serious ; just hit him in a bad spot that 's all . " . RHP Mitch Harris was placed on the 15 - day disabled list Saturday after sustaining a right groin strain while warming up in the bullpen Friday night . 	 Pirates : OF Starling Marte returned to the lineup Saturday after missing the previous five games because of discomfort in his left side . The team leader in home runs
column37: Marte batted cleanup and went 1 for 4 . 	 Randy Arozarena hit 20 home runs and stole 20 bases this season

column3: Yangervis Solarte turned what could have been another one - run loss into a rare comeback win for the San Diego Padres . 	 Solarte hit a two - run homer off Texas closer Shawn Tolleson with two outs in the ninth inning
column4: and the Padres rallied to end a season - high six - game losing streak with a 6 - 5 victory over the Rangers on Saturday night . 	 Solarte 's drive down the right - field line handed Tolleson ( 2 - 2 ) his first blown save when he had a chance to be the first pitcher in five years to convert the first 14 chances of his career . 	 The fifth homer for Solarte was just the second time in 45 games that San Diego won when trailing after eight innings . 	 " It looked like all was lost and Solarte came up big
column5: " interim manager Pat Murphy said . " It was a great feeling for our guys . They deserve it . They 've played everybody tough and came up short on the road . " 	 Solarte reached base four times and scored three runs . Former Texas reliever Joaquin Benoit ( 6 - 4 ) won despite allowing a run in the eighth
column6: and Craig Kimbrel struck out the side in the ninth for his 22nd save . 	 Mitch Moreland homered twice for the Rangers
column7: who lost for the ninth time in 10 home games . 	 The Padres
column9: were on the verge of their fifth one - run loss in a span of seven games after pinch - runner Andrew Cashner was thrown out by Rangers left fielder Josh Hamilton trying to go to third on Melvin Upton Jr. 's RBI single that cut the Texas lead to 5 - 4 . 	 Three pitches later
column10: Solarte pulled a fastball down the line a few rows into the seats as Texas right fielder Shin - Soo Choo watched helplessly at the wall . 	 Elvis Andrus gave Texas a run to spare with a run - scoring double in the eighth
column11: but Tolleson could n't hold it . He gave up five hits and three runs in two - thirds of an inning
column12: getting replaced by Spencer Patton after Solarte 's homer was followed by a single from Matt Kemp
column13: who had a two - run homer in the third . 	 Tolleson took over as closer in May when Neftali Feliz was removed from that role after blowing three saves in nine chances . The closer for both of Texas ' World Series teams in 2010 - 11
column14: Feliz declined a minor league option Friday after getting designated for assignment and became a free agent . He agreed to terms with Detroit on Saturday . 	 " My command might not have been quite as good tonight
column15: " Tolleson said . " I 'm anxious to get back out there and get the job done . " 	 Moreland twice gave the Rangers leads with solo homers -- in the second for the game 's first run before breaking a 3 - all tie and knocking Padres ace James Shields out of the game . 	 Shields remained winless in seven straight starts
column16: but it was the first time in that span that San Diego won . 	 He matched a season high with four walks -- the third time he 's had that many in the past five starts . Three came in the third after Kemp had given him a 2 - 1 lead with his eighth homer . 	 Walks to Odor and Delino DeShields around a double by Robinson Chirinos loaded the bases with no outs . After Choo tied the score on a double - play grounder to second
column17: Prince Fielder beat the shift with an opposite - field single to left for a 3 - 2 lead . 	 Kemp 's homer came after Colby Lewis hit Solarte with a pitch with two outs in the third . In the fifth
column18: Justin Upton singled after consecutive two - out walks to Solarte and Kemp
column19: scoring Solarte from second for a 3 - all tie . 	 SWINGING SOLARTE 	 The go - ahead homer was the first of Solarte 's career in the seventh inning or later . He reached base at least four times for the second time this season
column20: and is the third San Diego player this year to reach with a hit
column21: a walk and a hit by pitch in the same game . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Padres : Murphy said RHP Brandon Morrow came out of three innings of simulated work OK and should be ready for a rehab assignment that is to be determined . 	 Rangers : LHP Derek Holland is closing in on his first session of live batting practice since going on the DL on April 11 with a left shoulder strain . column1: SAN FRANCISCO --   Someone asked Giants manager Bruce Bochy if it was too late to add Matt Duffy to the All - Star Game . 	 " Maybe not
column2: " Bochy said of his third baseman
column3: who has given the Giants stability at a position manned by postseason star Pablo Sandoval the past few years . 	 Angel Pagan and Duffy each drove in a pair of runs in the sixth inning and the San Francisco Giants rallied to beat the Philadelphia Phillies 8 - 5 on Saturday night . 	 Brandon Crawford had three hits and drove in a run for the Giants
column4: who have won three of four after a seven - game losing streak . 	 Duffy
column5: who had four hits in Friday night 's victory
column6: was a home run shy of the cycle for the second straight day . 	 " The door was opened for him and he 's taken advantage
column7: " Pagan said . " He 's really impressive . " 	 Duffy opened the year batting seventh or eighth and has risen to the third spot
column8: where he 's hitting .309 in 16 games . Pagan started the year as the No . 3 hitter and feels more comfortable leading off . 	 " I liked what I saw from him last year
column9: " Giants starter Ryan Vogelsong said of Duffy . " If you can say anything about him
column10: it 's that he 's a gamer . " 	 Josh Osich ( 1 - 0 ) recorded the final out of the sixth and earned his first major league victory . Santiago Casilla got the final out for his 22nd save . 	 Ryan Howard hit a home run and drove in two and Cody Asche added a two - run shot for the Phillies
column11: who have lost four straight and 14 of 17 overall . Freddy Galvis doubled and tripled and Odubel Herrera had two hits and drove in a run . 	 " There 's a reason these guys are the champions
column12: " Howard said . " Even when they get down they continue to fight . It 's a battle for 27 outs and we came up at the wrong end . " 	 Luis Garcia ( 3 - 4 ) gave up three runs in 2/3 innings after allowing two over his previous 15 innings . 	 David Buchanan pitched five strong innings in his return to the rotation
column13: but still has not won in 15 consecutive starts dating to last August . He made his first start for the Phillies since April 30 . 	 Buchanan allowed a run on eight hits . He did not walk a batter and struck out three . 	 Vogelsong took his second straight no decision . He gave up four runs on five hits . Vogelsong walked three and struck out five . 	 The Giants batted around in the sixth
column14: scoring all five runs with two outs . Buster Posey
column16: also drove in a run . San Francisco has accumulated 37 hits in the past two games . Giants : Left - hander Jeremy Affledt ( left shoulder strain ) is tentatively scheduled for a July 20 return . 	 SPLASH HIT : 	 Asche became the first Phillie to hit a ball into McCovey Cove
column17: the body of water just beyond the right field fence connected to the San Francisco Bay
column18: and was the 37th hit by an opponent . There have been 105 total ` splash ' hits
